TopicTitle: Find lat/lon of entry interface when using FAR and RSS

Articles.Content: I'm using FAR and 6.4x RSS, and I'm trying to find the location of the spacecraft relative to the surface at entry interface. Trajectories doesn't work with RSS, any ideas?

any ideas?

Trouble is that Kerbin rotates under your orbit, so the entry interface Lat/Lon will constantly be changing. Or maybe I don't really understand your question? Can you be more specific?
I'd like to find out what my lat/long will be at or around a specific altitude on a given pass.

OK. While I could work it out for myself, I don't understand why you would want these values? What would you hope to achieve by knowing them? Wouldn't you be more interested in where you are going to land? The lat/lon of your entry interface really has no bearing on where that will be because you could end up in entirely different locations depending on how steeply you reenter. I've never used it but I think MechJeb has a landing targeting function, doesn't it? Maybe that would help? Sorry I can't offer anything more useful than that.
